properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 9 at 2:26PM CST until January 12 at 6:00AM CST by NWS La Crosse WI
properties.description:
...Slick Travel Will Continue Along and North Interstate 94 This
Afternoon...

...Winter Storm Impacting The Area Saturday into Saturday Night...

.Patchy freezing drizzle will continue across Clark and Taylor
counties in north-central Wisconsin this afternoon. A light glaze
is possible.

Untreated roads and sidewalks will remain slick with a light
glazing of ice. If you have travel planned this afternoon, slow
down and be prepared for slippery conditions.

Confidence is increasing on a winter storm impacting the area
Saturday into Saturday night with significant snowfall. Right now,
it looks like some areas from far southwestern into central
Wisconsin could see 6 or more inches of accumulation.

If you have any travel plans this weekend, please stay up to date
on the latest forecast information.

* WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 7
inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph.

* WHERE...Juneau, Adams, Richland and Grant Counties.

* WHEN...From Saturday afternoon through late Saturday night.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT
